author: Staff Reporter
text:
Branding the Communist Party of India (Marxist) anti-national, three activists of the Aam Aadmi Sena vandalised the party’s national headquarters at Gole Market here on Sunday.

Around 3.30 p.m. the three youths — Sushant, Vedprakash and Rocky Chauhan — reached A.K. Gopalan Bhawan, the party’s office at Bhai Vir Singh Marg, and started raising slogans against the party and its leaders.

The were protesting against statements made by CPI(M) and CPI leaders on the Jawaharlal Nehru University controversy. They alleged that Aparajita, daughter of CPI leader D. Raja, was one of those who had allegedly chanted seditious slogans on February 9 inside the JNU campus.
title: CPI(M) office attacked
